poem:
### A World on Borrowed Time

The earth whispers warnings  
on wind's weary breath,  
yet power plays deaf,  
feasting on falsehoods.  
Truth waits at the edge,  
a ghost at the gathering.  
Who will rise  
from the shadows?  
Not the giants  
with greed's green hands,  
but the grass,  
breaking through  
cracks with  
quiet conviction.
